Detailed Description

Parameter Block Class.

The MuParamBlock class is used to wrap a vector of floating point values, so that these these values may be assigned, copied, and otherwise manipulated without the programmer having to deal with memory management. Parameters in an MuParamBlock are used to provide csound scores with note definitions other than the basic set of parameters which constitute a note object (see MuNote). Generally, every note inside a music material has an MuParamBlock whose size depends on the number of parameters required by its containing voice. A copy of this block may be obtained through the note’s methods (MuNote.h). The correct number of parameters is provided by the voice’s methods (MuVoice.h). When building an isolated note, client code tipically declares an MuParamblock object, modify its values and then hands the entire block over to the note. MuParamBlocks allow:

  • growing array size without previous data loss
  • reducing array size by cropping the upper elements
  • accessing values through [ ] operator or accessor functions

Member Function Documentation

MuError MuParamBlock::AddParam ( float  newValue  ) 

Appends newValue to the end of an MuParamBlock's internal array.

Appends newValue to the end of an MuParamBlock's internal array. If object has no previous data, AddParam() initializes array with one item and sets its value to newValue. In case of memory allocation failure, AddParam() aborts with an error.

Returns:
  • upon success, AddParam() returns MuERROR_NONE
  • if memory allocation fails, AddParam() returns MuERROR_INSUF_MEM

Definition at line 222 of file MuParamBlock.cpp.

releases internal array memory.

Definition at line 142 of file MuParamBlock.cpp.

MuError MuParamBlock::Grow ( uShort  n  ) 

Appends n elements to the end of internal array.

If an MuParamBlock object is empty (not initialized), Grow() initializes it with n elements. If it contains previous data, Grow() appends n elements to the end of the object’s internal array and sets every element to zero. If memory allocation fails, Grow() terminates with an error, leaving internal array untouched.

Returns:
  • upon success, Grow() returns MuERROR_NONE
  • if memory allocation fails, Grow() returns MuERROR_INSUF_MEM

Definition at line 262 of file MuParamBlock.cpp.

MuError MuParamBlock::Init ( uShort  n  ) 

Initializes internal array with n values.

Init() should only be used with an MuParamBlock object which has not been initialized. MuParamBlock objects with previous data may be resized by either a call to the Clear() method followed by Init(), or a call to Grow() or Trunc().

Parameters:
n uShort - number of array elements to be allocated
Returns:
  • upon success, Init() returns MuERROR_NONE
  • if n is zero, Init() returns MuERROR_INVALID_PARAMBLOCK_SIZE;
  • if object contains previous data, Init() returns MuERROR_CANNONT_INIT;

uShort MuParamBlock::Num ( void   ) 

Returns number of array elements.

Informs the number of values in internal array. If the parameter block is uninitialized, Num() returns zero.

Returns:
uShort - number of internal array items

Equality Operator.

Definition at line 83 of file MuParamBlock.cpp.

MuError MuParamBlock::SetVal ( uShort  which_param,
float  newValue 
)

Modifies the value of the requested array element.

Replaces the value of the item within position which_param of an MuParamBlock's internal array with newValue. Num() should be called beforehand, in order to obtain the correct bounds for the ParamBlock.

Returns:
  • upon success, SetVal() returns MuERROR_NONE
  • if object is not initialized, SetVal() returns MuERROR_PARAM_BLOCK_NOT_INITIALIZED
  • if which_parameter is out of bounds, SetVal() returns MuERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER

Definition at line 189 of file MuParamBlock.cpp.

MuError MuParamBlock::Trunc ( uShort  n  ) 

Crops the end of internal array by n elements.

Trunc() eliminates the upper n elements of an MuParamBlock object’s internal array. If n is greater then current array size, or if object is not initialized, or yet if memory allocation fails, Trunc() terminates with an error, leaving internal array untouched. If n equals current array size, Trunc() calls Clear() thus reseting the MuParamBlock object to its uninitialized state.

Returns:
  • upon success, Trunc() returns MuERROR_NONE
  • if n > current size, Trunc() returns MuERROR_INVALID_PARAMBLOCK_SIZE
  • if memory allocation fails, Trunc() returns MuERROR_INSUF_MEM

Definition at line 304 of file MuParamBlock.cpp.

MuError MuParamBlock::Val ( uShort  which_param,
float *  theValue 
)

Returns the value at requested array position.

returns the value of the item within position which_param of an MuParamBlock's internal array. The value is returned through pointer outVal, which should contain the address of a valid floating point variable. Num() should be called before iterating through an MuParamBlock's values, in order to obtain the correct bounds for the block.

Returns:
  • upon success, Val() returns MuERROR_NONE
  • if object is not initialized, Val() returns MuERROR_PARAM_BLOCK_NOT_INITIALIZED
  • if which_param is out of bounds, Val() returns MuERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER
